eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting

Class PivotManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting.PivotManager

  • public class PivotManager
extends Object
    Creates a pivot-based, multi-dimensional RR*-tree and then handles multi-attribute similarity search requests. CAUTION! A single instance of this class is created by the coordinator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PivotManager

        public PivotManager(int r,
                    Map<String,DatasetIdentifier> pivotDataIdentifiers,
                    Map<String,DatasetIdentifier> datasetIdentifiers,
                    Map<String,Map<?,?>> datasets,
                    Logger log)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        r - Total number of reference values (pivots).
        pivotDataIdentifiers - Dictionary of the attributes available for PIVOT-based similarity search operations.
        datasetIdentifiers - Dictionary of the attributes available for similarity search operations.
        datasets - Dictionary of the attribute datasets available for querying.
        log - Handle to the log file for notifications and execution statistics.

    • Method Detail

      • findIdentifier

        private DatasetIdentifier findIdentifier(String column)
        Finds the internal identifier used for the data of a given attribute.
        Parameters:
        column - The name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        The internal dataset identifier.

      • exportEmbeddings

        public void exportEmbeddings(String csvFileName,
                             List<Entry<Object,Point>> embeddings)
        Exports the embeddings of input objects indexed in the RR*-tree into a CSV file.
        Parameters:
        csvFileName - The name of the output CSV file.
        embeddings - The collection of the embeddings with an entry per input entity. Object: the identifier; Point: a multi-dimensional point with the embedded ordinate values.

      • embed

        private double[] embed(Map<String,Point> q)
        Only used for embedding query points before searching in the index.
        Parameters:
        q - M-dimensional query point (one value per attribute)
        Returns:
        The embedding (i.e., distance values from pivots) of the query point.

      • randomSample

        public <T> List<T> randomSample(Collection<T> inCol,
                                int n)
        Provides a random sample of given size from a list of objects
        Parameters:
        inCol - Input collection of objects of a given type.
        n - The number of objects to choose.
        Returns:
        A randomly chosen subset of the given objects.

      • constructQueryPoint

        private Point constructQueryPoint(String attr,
                                  DataType.Type datatype,
                                  Object val,
                                  boolean transform)
        Constructs a (multi-dimensional) point from the query value specified for the given attribute.
        Parameters:
        attr - The queried attribute.
        datatype - The data type of the query value; should match that of the respective attribute.
        val - The parsed query value.
        transform - Boolean specifying whether the query value (set of keywords) should be transformed (into an array of doubles)
        Returns:
        A (multi-dimensional) point to be used in the search against the index.

      • index

        public boolean index(MetricReferences ref,
                     String tokenDelimiter,
                     Map<String,Map<String,Point>> records)
        Indexing stage: Construct an RR*-tree index based on the input records, using the given distances and determining suitable reference points (i.e., pivots)
        Parameters:
        ref - The distance reference to be used for embedding input records.
        tokenDelimiter - The delimiter character between coordinates in attribute values
        records - Input collection of records: (identifier, point) pairs per attribute.
        Returns:
        True, if the index has been successfully constructed; otherwise, False.

      • addExtraQuerySpecs

        private SearchSpecs addExtraQuerySpecs(String attrName,
                                       int weightCombinations)
        Adding specification for an attribute used in the index, but not specified in the use query.
        Parameters:
        attrName - The name of the missing attribute.
        weightCombinations - The number of weight combinations specified for other attributes in the query.
        Returns:
        An extra query specification for an attribute.

      • search

        public SearchResponse[] search(SearchRequest params)
        Searching stage: Given a user-specified configuration, execute the pivot-based similarity search and issue the ranked top-k results. This method accepts an instance of SearchRequest class.
        Parameters:
        params - An instance of SearchRequest class with the multi-facet search query specifications.
        Returns:
        A JSON-formatted response with the ranked results.

      • sortByScore

        private RankedResult[] sortByScore(IResult[] results)
        Sorts the results by their final similarity score instead of the rankings determined by the pivot-based distances in the index.
        Parameters:
        results - The query results as ranked by the tree index.
        Returns:
        The results sorted by descending similarity score.

      • issueRankedResult

        private RankedResult issueRankedResult(int i,
                                       Object oid,
                                       double distByIndex,
                                       List<String> missingAttributes,
                                       boolean exact)
        Prepares the next result for reporting, along with its original attribute values as used in the raw data. NOT USED: This variant does not provide similarity scores per attribute.
        Parameters:
        i - The rank of the result in the top-k list.
        oid - An entity identifier
        distByIndex - The weighted distance of this result as returned by the index.
        missingAttributes - The names of the attributes not specified in the user's query.
        exact - Boolean specifying whether this result is exact (true) or approximate (false).
        Returns:
        The next result to report.

      • issueRankedResult

        private RankedResult issueRankedResult(int i,
                                       Object oid,
                                       double distByIndex,
                                       Map<String,Point> qPoint,
                                       double[] w,
                                       List<String> missingAttributes,
                                       boolean exact)
        Prepares the next result for reporting, along with its original attribute values as used in the raw data. This variant calculates the similarity scores per attribute for each result w.r.t. the query.
        Parameters:
        i - The rank of the result in the top-k list.
        oid - An entity identifier of the result.
        distByIndex - The weighted distance of this result as returned by the index.
        qPoint - The query with its user-specified attribute values.
        w - The combination of weights to apply per attribute for estimating the similarity score.
        missingAttributes - The names of the attributes not specified in the user's query.
        exact - Boolean specifying whether this result is exact (true) or approximate (false).
        Returns:
        The next result to report.

      • getAttrSpecs

        private ResultFacet getAttrSpecs(DatasetIdentifier datasetId,
                                 Object oid)
        Provides an attribute name and its value for a given entity in a dataset.
        Parameters:
        datasetId - The dataset identifier of the attribute values.
        oid - The identifier of a given object in the dataset.
        Returns:
        The name and value for an attribute of the requested entity to be reported in the results.

      • isCollectQueryStats

        public boolean isCollectQueryStats()
        Indicates whether the platform is empirically evaluated and collects execution statistics.
        Returns:
        True, if collecting execution statistics; otherwise, False.

      • setCollectQueryStats

        public void setCollectQueryStats(boolean collectQueryStats)
        Specifies whether the platform will be collecting execution statistics when running performance tests.
        Parameters:
        collectQueryStats - True, if collecting execution statistics; otherwise, False.
